channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CSPRD: A Financial Policy Retrieval Dataset for Chinese Stock Market
item.description: In recent years, great advances in pre-trained language models (PLMs) have sparked considerable research focus and achieved promising performance on the approach of dense passage retrieval, which aims at retrieving relative passages from massive corpus with given questions.

item.title: Unsupervised Object Localization with Representer Point Selection
item.description: We propose a novel unsupervised object localization method that allows us to explain the predictions of the model by utilizing self-supervised pre-trained models without additional finetuning.

item.title: PRISTA-Net: Deep Iterative Shrinkage Thresholding Network for Coded Diffraction Patterns Phase Retrieval
item.description: This network utilizes a learnable nonlinear transformation to address the proximal-point mapping sub-problem associated with the sparse priors, and an attention mechanism to focus on phase information containing image edges, textures, and structures.

item.title: Measuring and Improving Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in Vision-Language Models
item.description: Based on this pipeline and the existing coarse-grained annotated dataset, we build the CURE benchmark to measure both the zero-shot reasoning performance and consistency of VLMs.

item.title: Language Prompt for Autonomous Driving
item.description: A new trend in the computer vision community is to capture objects of interest following flexible human command represented by a natural language prompt.

item.title: CNN Injected Transformer for Image Exposure Correction
item.description: Capturing images with incorrect exposure settings fails to deliver a satisfactory visual experience.

item.title: Toward Sufficient Spatial-Frequency Interaction for Gradient-aware Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: Underwater images suffer from complex and diverse degradation, which inevitably affects the performance of underwater visual tasks.

item.title: Encoding Multi-Domain Scientific Papers by Ensembling Multiple CLS Tokens
item.description: Many useful tasks on scientific documents, such as topic classification and citation prediction, involve corpora that span multiple scientific domains.

item.title: Soft Quantization using Entropic Regularization
item.description: This contribution investigates the properties and robustness of the entropy-regularized quantization problem, which relaxes the standard quantization problem.

item.title: Offline Recommender System Evaluation under Unobserved Confounding
item.description: Because the data collection policy is typically under the practitioner's control, the unconfoundedness assumption is often left implicit, and its violations are rarely dealt with in the existing literature.

item.title: Active Learning for Classifying 2D Grid-Based Level Completability
item.description: Determining the completability of levels generated by procedural generators such as machine learning models can be challenging, as it can involve the use of solver agents that often require a significant amount of time to analyze and solve levels.

item.title: Computationally Efficient Data-Driven Discovery and Linear Representation of Nonlinear Systems For Control
item.description: This work focuses on developing a data-driven framework using Koopman operator theory for system identification and linearization of nonlinear systems for control.

item.title: UQ at #SMM4H 2023: ALEX for Public Health Analysis with Social Media
item.description: As social media becomes increasingly popular, more and more activities related to public health emerge.

item.title: Generating the Ground Truth: Synthetic Data for Label Noise Research
item.description: It allows for creating a noiseless dataset informed by real data, by either pre-specifying or learning a function and defining it as the ground truth function from which labels are generated.

item.title: ConDA: Contrastive Domain Adaptation for AI-generated Text Detection
item.description: Given the potential malicious nature in which these LLMs can be used to generate disinformation at scale, it is important to build effective detectors for such AI-generated text.

item.title: Equal Long-term Benefit Rate: Adapting Static Fairness Notions to Sequential Decision Making
item.description: Moreover, we show that the policy gradient of Long-term Benefit Rate can be analytically reduced to standard policy gradient.

item.title: Your Battery Is a Blast! Safeguarding Against Counterfeit Batteries with Authentication
item.description: By using our proposed methodologies, manufacturers can ensure that devices only use legitimate batteries, guaranteeing the operational state of any system and safety measures for the users.

item.title: Evaluation of large language models for discovery of gene set function
item.description: Gene set analysis is a mainstay of functional genomics, but it relies on manually curated databases of gene functions that are incomplete and unaware of biological context.

item.title: Broadband Ground Motion Synthesis via Generative Adversarial Neural Operators: Development and Validation
item.description: We present a data-driven model for ground-motion synthesis using a Generative Adversarial Neural Operator (GANO) that combines recent advancements in machine learning and open access strong motion data sets to generate three-component acceleration time histories conditioned on moment magnitude ($M$), rupture distance ($R_{rup}$), time-average shear-wave velocity at the top $30m$ ($V_{S30}$), and tectonic environment or style of faulting.

item.title: CPU frequency scheduling of real-time applications on embedded devices with temporal encoding-based deep reinforcement learning
item.description: We develop a reinforcement-learning-based technique with temporal encoding to derive an effective DVFS governor even with the presence of the three system patterns.

item.title: Stroke-based Neural Painting and Stylization with Dynamically Predicted Painting Region
item.description: To solve the problem, we propose Compositional Neural Painter, a novel stroke-based rendering framework which dynamically predicts the next painting region based on the current canvas, instead of dividing the image plane uniformly into painting regions.

item.title: DetermiNet: A Large-Scale Diagnostic Dataset for Complex Visually-Grounded Referencing using Determiners
item.description: We find that current state-of-the-art visual grounding models do not perform well on the dataset, highlighting the limitations of existing models on reference and quantification tasks.

item.title: A Natural Gas Consumption Forecasting System for Continual Learning Scenarios based on Hoeffding Trees with Change Point Detection Mechanism
item.description: Forecasting natural gas consumption, considering seasonality and trends, is crucial in planning its supply and consumption and optimizing the cost of obtaining it, mainly by industrial entities.

item.title: Box-based Refinement for Weakly Supervised and Unsupervised Localization Tasks
item.description: It has been established that training a box-based detector network can enhance the localization performance of weakly supervised and unsupervised methods.

item.title: A-Eval: A Benchmark for Cross-Dataset Evaluation of Abdominal Multi-Organ Segmentation
item.description: To address these questions, we introduce A-Eval, a benchmark for the cross-dataset Evaluation ('Eval') of Abdominal ('A') multi-organ segmentation.

item.title: Learning continuous-valued treatment effects through representation balancing
item.description: In this work, we propose CBRNet, a causal machine learning approach to estimate an individual dose response from observational data.

item.title: Learning Compact Compositional Embeddings via Regularized Pruning for Recommendation
item.description: In addition, we innovatively design a regularized pruning mechanism in CERP, such that the two sparsified meta-embedding tables are encouraged to encode information that is mutually complementary.

item.title: CenTime: Event-Conditional Modelling of Censoring in Survival Analysis
item.description: We demonstrate that our approach forms a consistent estimator for the event model parameters, even in the absence of uncensored data.

item.title: Dynamic Frame Interpolation in Wavelet Domain
item.description: Video frame interpolation is an important low-level vision task, which can increase frame rate for more fluent visual experience.

item.title: BroadCAM: Outcome-agnostic Class Activation Mapping for Small-scale Weakly Supervised Applications
item.description: Class activation mapping~(CAM), a visualization technique for interpreting deep learning models, is now commonly used for weakly supervised semantic segmentation~(WSSS) and object localization~(WSOL).

item.title: Toward High Quality Facial Representation Learning
item.description: To improve the facial representation quality, we use feature map of a pre-trained visual backbone as a supervision item and use a partially pre-trained decoder for mask image modeling.

item.title: DiffDefense: Defending against Adversarial Attacks via Diffusion Models
item.description: This paper presents a novel reconstruction method that leverages Diffusion Models to protect machine learning classifiers against adversarial attacks, all without requiring any modifications to the classifiers themselves.

item.title: Multimodal Transformer for Material Segmentation
item.description: We also propose a new model named Multi-Modal Segmentation Transformer (MMSFormer) that incorporates the proposed fusion strategy to perform multimodal material segmentation.

item.title: Phasic Content Fusing Diffusion Model with Directional Distribution Consistency for Few-Shot Model Adaption
item.description: To address these problems, we propose a novel phasic content fusing few-shot diffusion model with directional distribution consistency loss, which targets different learning objectives at distinct training stages of the diffusion model.

item.title: Exploring Sparse MoE in GANs for Text-conditioned Image Synthesis
item.description: Due to the difficulty in scaling up, generative adversarial networks (GANs) seem to be falling from grace on the task of text-conditioned image synthesis.

item.title: Separable Self and Mixed Attention Transformers for Efficient Object Tracking
item.description: Our ablation study testifies to the effectiveness of the proposed combination of backbone and head modules.

item.title: Perceptual Quality Assessment of 360$^\circ$ Images Based on Generative Scanpath Representation
item.description: To address these issues, we introduce a unique generative scanpath representation (GSR) for effective quality inference of 360$^\circ$ images, which aggregates varied perceptual experiences of multi-hypothesis users under a predefined viewing condition.

item.title: Simulating room transfer functions between transducers mounted on audio devices using a modified image source method
item.description: The image source method (ISM) is often used to simulate room acoustics due to its ease of use and computational efficiency.

item.title: Context-Aware 3D Object Localization from Single Calibrated Images: A Study of Basketballs
item.description: Accurately localizing objects in three dimensions (3D) is crucial for various computer vision applications, such as robotics, autonomous driving, and augmented reality.

item.title: Evaluating ChatGPT as a Recommender System: A Rigorous Approach
item.description: Through thoroughly exploring ChatGPT's abilities in recommender systems, our study aims to contribute to the growing body of research on the versatility and potential applications of large language models.

item.title: AnthroNet: Conditional Generation of Humans via Anthropometrics
item.description: We present a novel human body model formulated by an extensive set of anthropocentric measurements, which is capable of generating a wide range of human body shapes and poses.

item.title: Insights Into the Inner Workings of Transformer Models for Protein Function Prediction
item.description: Motivation: We explored how explainable AI (XAI) can help to shed light into the inner workings of neural networks for protein function prediction, by extending the widely used XAI method of integrated gradients such that latent representations inside of transformer models, which were finetuned to Gene Ontology term and Enzyme Commission number prediction, can be inspected too.

item.title: PyGraft: Configurable Generation of Schemas and Knowledge Graphs at Your Fingertips
item.description: In some data-sensitive fields such as education or medicine, access to public datasets is even more limited.

item.title: Privacy-preserving Continual Federated Clustering via Adaptive Resonance Theory
item.description: In the clustering domain, various algorithms with a federated learning framework (i. e., federated clustering) have been actively studied and showed high clustering performance while preserving data privacy.

item.title: Tracking Anything with Decoupled Video Segmentation
item.description: To 'track anything' without training on video data for every individual task, we develop a decoupled video segmentation approach (DEVA), composed of task-specific image-level segmentation and class/task-agnostic bi-directional temporal propagation.

item.title: A Function Interpretation Benchmark for Evaluating Interpretability Methods
item.description: Labeling neural network submodules with human-legible descriptions is useful for many downstream tasks: such descriptions can surface failures, guide interventions, and perhaps even explain important model behaviors.

item.title: ImageBind-LLM: Multi-modality Instruction Tuning
item.description: During training, we adopt a learnable bind network to align the embedding space between LLaMA and ImageBind's image encoder.

item.title: DoLa: Decoding by Contrasting Layers Improves Factuality in Large Language Models
item.description: Despite their impressive capabilities, large language models (LLMs) are prone to hallucinations, i. e., generating content that deviates from facts seen during pretraining.

item.title: MLN-net: A multi-source medical image segmentation method for clustered microcalcifications using multiple layer normalization
item.description: Extensive experiments validate the effectiveness of MLN-net in segmenting clustered microcalcifications from different domains and the its segmentation accuracy surpasses state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: Reasonable Anomaly Detection in Long Sequences
item.description: In this paper, we propose to completely represent the motion patterns of objects by learning from long-term sequences.
